oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Results from new fungus-tolerant grapevine varieties for Organic Viticulture
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schwab, A. L.
Knott, R.
Schottdorf, W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding, genetics and propagation
Viticulture
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two red and three white new fungus-tolerant grape varieties were tested within a period of five years. REGENT, RONDO, JOHANNITER and Gf 48-12 show a better wine quality than PINOT NOIR or SILVANER and can be recommended for Organic Viticulture as well as for the conventional viticulture to reduce copper and fungicide applications.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schwab, A. L.; Knott, R. and Schottdorf, W. (2000) Results from new fungus-tolerant grapevine varieties for Organic Viticulture. In: Willer, Helga and Meier, Urs (Eds.) Proceedings 6th International Congress on Organic Viticulture, Stiftung Ökologie & Landbau, Bad Dürkheim, SÖL-Sonderausgabe, no. 77, pp. 225-227.
